Description: Rim and neck sherd of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black on top of rim and neck; outside and underside of rim slipped white; on outside painted decoration consisting of black maeander pattern between rows of single dots.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA198. The sherd belongs in Stibbe's Group E, the group of kraters with geometric rim ornaments only (Stibbe, 1989, 33).
Bibliographic references: Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 103)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.43) (phase 3)
